website_summaries.verdict: Effective, ergonomic, and flattering. There's a reason the O'Neill brand is synonymous with sun and surf.
pros: Minimal seam placement for maximum rash protection
Flattering on almost any body shape
cons: May run a little small – consider sizing up when ordering

customer_reviews.title: I love this rashguard
customer_reviews.text: This rash guard does a great job. I am a 36DD so I ordered a large and ir fits perfectly. The only suggestion I have is if u get the color black, u should wash it out by hand a couple of times because the color runs alot.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a true size small
customer_reviews.text: Fits exceptionally well. The colour is softer than pictured, more minty-teal. Really gorgeous on my olive skin. I am 5'3, 117lbs, 34A-B. The size small JUST fit. It covers to my hip bones, and comfortably snug all over, not suffocating. Warning: If you are taller than me, the sleeves will be too short.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Size up if you have some fats
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2 and a bit chubby at 129-130lbs, with wide shoulder and flubby arms. One I wear in pic is XL. Fits nice and perfect but I'm still hoping to get a size larger for a sliiightly looser look, unfortunately xl is the biggest size available here . The large fits comftably too but too tight looking for my liking. I bought this for the sole purpose of just wearing it while sitting on the sand watching my toddler play in the shore, that's why I don't want a skin tight fit. This size is perfect for me though when going in the water. Overall quality is nice.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for sun protection
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6" 135 lb, usually wear tops in size S. I tried this shirt in both S and M sizes. The S fit snug but bearable in the body, but the sleeves were way too tight in the forearm area. The M was slightly bigger, but still snug in the body and in the arms. I guess the shirt has to be if you are actually surfing. I just use it for sun protection over my bathing suit, and it works great for that. No sunburns all day! The stitching looks great, and the teal color is very pretty
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Kateryna

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: No free returns and this shirt can fit very tight!
customer_reviews.text: I did look through the reviews and saw that this shirt runs small even for a rashguard. I typically wear a medium top, but decided to order up to a large based on the feedback. The large is so tight around my chest that I can barely breathe. I went to return the shirt and just then noticed that returns are not free. So beware to potential buyers with larger chests....you might want to consider ordering up at least one size (or maybe even two sizes). Or, consider buying from a location where you can return and exchange sizes as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Item sent very different from photo
customer_reviews.text: The construction of the rash guard sent was totally different from the one that is pictured (i.e., that I ordered). What arrived is just a rash guard in the shape of a long-sleeved shirt, with hidden seams. Just kind of plain and dorky. The sleeves were also a good 2cm shorter than the sleeves on all of my other standard cut rash guards. The sporty, angled, flat, visible stitching is what made this rash guard attractive to me. I've ordered O'Neill rash guards before and never had any problem. Update: Seller approved return and processed my refund, so no complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: not from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Size up!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how people said these are true to size, they run SMALL!! They’re very well made tho. So i only knocked off one star. I love the white (with blue accent) shirt. Very cute. I am a 36C and the large was wayyyyy too tight!!! Just returned to exchange with an XL. Hopefully it fits. I will update after the replacement arrives. **update: XL arrived and it was not any bigger than the Large. So it’s going back again. I’m done trying with this brand. I have small hands and i had to seriously squeeze my hands thru the sleeves. I don’t understand how everyone else fits in theirs!
customer_reviews.author: Cherries27

customer_reviews.title: Been using this brand for years! Great for pregnancy too =)
customer_reviews.text: I am a small in womens but got myself a medium. That worked great! These are snug and if you prefer to have looser clothes on then size up twice! However, this one I got because I am in the last part of the pregnancy and it fits GREAT! I needed the extra abdominal room and this stretches nicely! Also I have been using this brand of rash guard for years and I have NEVER gotten a sunburn nor needed a single drop of sunblock (only regarding the spots this top covers). So it works! However, do apply sunblock to the rest of your body including your hands.
customer_reviews.author: ClassyCurly

customer_reviews.title: CAN’T TRUST SIZE OR COLOR
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two, large shirts. As you can see, the blue one is much smaller than the coral one. The second pic shows both are large. Ordered from the same place. The blue large is much smaller in width, length of shirt and length of sleeve. The blue looks like an extra small instead of a large. The coral one is large and is correct in size but the color (grapefruit) is nothing like the color advertised. The coral one that fits like a proper large was made in Egypt. The blue large (which fits like an extra small) was made in Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY snug fit!
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I sized up. I normally wear a M and so I got a L and I'm only a 34B. I was able to get it on but felt like a sausage roll. Giving it to my 12 year old daughter as it fits her much better. If you like a snug fit, go one size up. Want room to move, consider 2 sizes. I bought this for kayaking and see shirt rolling up while rowing.
customer_reviews.author: Aleana Riddell

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Smaller is Better
customer_reviews.text: This top was an idea for me to keep warmer in pool water. I think I should have gotten a smaller size which would have been a tighter fit for my body. The larger size when wet after time in the pool causes me to feel chilled. I got an extra large based on other's comments about top fitting too tight. My thought if you are using this top to stay warmer in pool water. one might not want the top to be too big. The seller was prompt and the top was as described. I would order the product and from vender again.
customer_reviews.author: liberty girl

customer_reviews.title: Great sun blocker for swimmers
customer_reviews.text: As an ocean swimmer, I need maximum mobility for my arms, yet a snug fit all around so I don’t have to deal with wet flapping material. This rash guard is the perfect fit for me — the manufacturer height and weight chart worked for me. When trying these on, remember it’s performance fit. That means it will be uncomfortably tight when dry, so it’s a good fit when wet.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Van Cleve

customer_reviews.title: 2 TIMES WAS NOT A CHARM....
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 ft 2” 105 lbs.I purchased both a small and a medium in the color fox pink.I prefer my tops to have a bit of room.The medium was absolutely enormous..So I tried the small size,and it could not be any tighter;in fact,I could barely breathe..When I placed the shirts on top of one another,there was at least 2 inch difference in width and length..The medium fox pink was more of a salmon color ,and the small fox pink was more of a hot pink..Very very disappointing.I feel this is a knock off..Poor workmanship..
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: I am really happy with the desicion
customer_reviews.text: I just receive mine today, did not use it yet. After reading the rewievs about the size, i ordered M instead of my actual size S. I am really happy with the desicion. I am 5.4 and 116 pounds. Since i will be wearing it at the pool, i don't need it skin tight. It is still very snug though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Shriver

customer_reviews.title: Size up!
customer_reviews.text: You really do need to size up! I am 5'0", 125lbs, and 34D chest. I am consistently a small in my shirts, and wear a size 6 dress. I ordered a medium, and it was so tight around my middle that it felt suctioned on. Update: the large fit perfectly! The photo is of the large. This is a replacement for a much older version of the same shirt, and the sun protection on my old one was great! Also, it was a hand-me-down from my SIL, and still lasted me a good 3-4 years. Highly recommend the product, but I would recommend sizing up more than you think you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fabric, order a size up and it'll fit perfect (snug) for surf
customer_reviews.text: I would order a size that you feel comfortable wearing when using a shirt. I ordered S thinking it would be snug like I wanted to and I usually wear M in shirts. I was able to put it on, but it was too tight, not even snug, so I had to sell it and get another one. And surprisingly M fit perfect for surfing. For reference, I'm 5'7 32A/B which according to sizing chart = Small. It does right up a little bit when paddling ,but it seems to happen with every rash guard I wear so I'm not surprised. The fabric is nice, and the color was even prettier in person.
customer_reviews.author: Ale Feragui

customer_reviews.title: Medium fit 5'3" 115lb, athletic built body
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Medium and it fits great! I am 5'3" 118lbs small bust and short torso. This is skin tight by nature. You wouldn't want it too big or too small. I got it to wear on the river for tubing and kayaking. I wore it all day since bouncing between the river, zip lining and the pool at our camp ground. I didn't feel hot either. I will definitely buy this brand again. I like the cut and fabric while on.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Literally fits tight like a glove. I like this feature as someone who is in the water its easy to move an not have a wet baggy shirt. I am 5'1" 139 lbs and ordered a large, big chest- so yeah not the most flattering when you're old and wearing a glove but beats a rash and burn. It really helped keep the sun off. I will most likely buy in other colors as I have Lupus and have reactions to the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa G.

customer_reviews.title: Size Up and Hope for the Best!
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is very inconsistent. I have purchased 4 of these spf rash guards from O'Neil. I am 5ft 9, 34C bust and a true M. Well, the M was too tight and I ordered L instead. 2 fit perfectly in the L and 2 were still suffocatingly tight. Since they offer the perfect sun protection when swimming and look great when they fit nicely, I am trying my luck with an XL. Fingers crossed...
customer_reviews.author: LMM

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rash guard. It seems to be good quality & is comfortable. With that being said, I would size up. I am 5”5 & 150 lbs. I usually pick between medium (if I want it snug) and large in tops depending on what it is. I wanted this to fit pretty tight, so I picked medium. I don’t hate it & I will use it but it is just a tiny bit too tight for what I’m comfortable with. Otherwise it’s a great swim shirt. Excited to see how the spf works.
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: While I know that swimwear is supposed to fit snug, I still expected to be able to wear this "XL" size top with comfort. The dress hanging behind photo 1 is "XL" Old Navy brand dress. This will give you an idea. While I could probably squeeze into it, I'm sure it would not be flattering. I don't know about sun protection, because I am sending it back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Great for swim workouts
customer_reviews.text: The small is perfect for me at 5'5'' and 120 lbs. I've swum several 2,000 yard workouts in the pool and lake and am very happy with this rash guard. It's comfortable and doesn't hinder swimming as I thought it might. It's tight and so far hasn't stretched out in the water or gotten damaged in the chlorine. Have no idea how long it will last, but am super happy with it now. And, the Tahitian blue matches perfect with my blue Speedo bag (not planned!).
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: size up, this runs extremely small
customer_reviews.text: I'm always a size small, but this top barely fit over my head and shoulders. I was able to get it on but it was not a good or flattering fit. It looks like it may even be a child's size. I will order another size, but I may have to go up to a large, which may be a tad roomy for a rash guard top, but I can't imagine that a medium would be sufficient. It's super small, ladies, and I'm petite and small.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Raper

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm please so far with the quality. It's soft and comfortable and keeps me protected from the sun. I swim a few times a week, so it's important to me to have a good rash guard. Usually, my rash guards need to be changed once a year (they eventually stretch out from wear and chlorine from the pool). I've been wearing this one since January. It's mid-March now. We'll see if it makes it to the one year mark. If it does, I'll re-order.
customer_reviews.author: yogi

customer_reviews.title: Skin tight
customer_reviews.text: I ordered up a size and it was still super tight. Depends on what you’re using it for, to be able to tolerate the tightness. My need is basic sun protection, therefore something looser fitting is more ideal. I sent this back and the great customer service gave me a refund. It is a great product for those that need a skin tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: Base your size on measurements!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’2” 115lbs and I got the medium based on measurements and review pics. It is the Performance Fit and fits just snug and not too tight. The wrists and forearms fit quite snug. The waist fits just snug. I don’t like it too tight across my chest (even though not much there - LOL) so this is a preferred fit for me. I’m guessing I could fit the small, but I like a less compressed feeling and not sure how much smaller it would feel. As far as O’Neill shirts go, these are more snug than than the short sleeved version that I also purchased in medium. Hope this helps a little.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Have bought many of this exact rash guard ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Have bought many of this exact rash guard and this particular one is thinner than in the past and has fallen apart and stretched out in just a few wearings. Quality is poor! Will now find another brand to buy.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Fits how I expected on my full figure body and love the color
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6 188 pounds 36DDD. I normally wear an XL In juniors clothing were it is not skin tight but fits well and comfortable. I know Oneil and Roxy brands run small and XL doesnt usually fit me usually on my arms and breasts, even though they are great brands. I gave this XL a shot and I am happy with what I recieved. It is skin tight like I like my rashgaurds and wetsuits I am in the process of losing weight so hopefully it will look more flattering minus a few pounds but over all I love the color and it works like a body suit sucking everything in haha! I would definitely buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wita

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shirt that would protect me from the sun uva/uvb. I loved the product. I weight 143lb and I’m 5,7”. I order a size Medium and it fit perfectly. It a little tight to my body’s but I like it like that. In the underarms is a little loose providing confer when swimming, it’s meant to be like that. For someone that like loose cloth I would recommend to size up. But overall the color is beautiful (I order the blue one and a white one). The material is not that thick so it won’t be uncomfortable to wear while on the beach, pool or exercising outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOOK FRICKEN SWEET
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Exactly what I was looking for. I wear a size small. I ordered a size small; fits perfectly. It is skin tight, as described, but still has enough give to not be uncomfortable. My chest is quite large relative to the rest of me so I was concerned about squishing/flattening/uniboob, but luckily that was not an issue at all. (Note: if you're on the top-heavy side like me, plan to wear a swim suit top under this as there definitely won't be enough support for outdoor activities otherwise.) I purchased this just to fend off the sun, but it actually looks fantastic with swimsuit bottoms too. Very slimming.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I received my shirt today. I will be wearing this Rash Guard to swim so I needed it to fit me tight. I normally wear a medium and went ahead and got the large due to reviews. It fits exactly how I want it to fit. Tight and comfortable. I am 5'7" 126 lbs and am a 34C. I consider my shoulders to be broad. Fits like a glove. The quality seems great. I will write another review if it's not after I wear it to swim
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Liddy

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not same color blue as in picture, and had stain
customer_reviews.text: I did not order a size up a some people did since more than 50% indicated that the fit was as expected. So, a medium was too small. Also, the blue was more of a navy blue rather than a pretty bright blue that was pictured. And there was a small stain on the front of the shirt. So, I returned it. I would have re-ordered a larger size, but was mainly unhappy with the color.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Willman

customer_reviews.title: Get a size up
customer_reviews.text: I found a review that was super helpful in ordering! The swim tops have two styles that are not well described. I ordered the performance top which has stitching like a wetsuit at an angle from the shoulder, this is a tighter fit. The other top on amazon has a straight shoulder stitching and is a more relaxed fit. The performance fit is meant to be tight. I am 5'6" and 125lbs. The medium is tight enough! A small would have not been comfortable at all! **** Check the pic and description when ordering! BUT- I love it.
customer_reviews.author: granma

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good sun protection, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Just wore it for the first time over the weekend - paddleboarding on a lake for about 2-3 hours. No sunburn, and even with temperatures in the 80s I was not overly warm with the long sleeves. No chafing or other discomfort, I had plenty of freedom of movement for paddling. The "deep sea" blue is a brighter blue than pictured, but I like it. The fit is tight to the skin, as it is supposed to be. I am 5'3", about 120lbs, 32D chest and the small fits me as I would like it to. Will probably get another in a different color!
customer_reviews.author: E.M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Large is too small... size up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a large, I’m a size 2-4 up top, pear shape with a 36-inch bust. Standard size female. I felt like I’d been stuffed into a sausage casing. The only reason I kept it is because it was a last minute purchase before a trip to the Keys where I’d be snorkeling in cool water. Glad I waited until the price dropped below $20.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great for snorkeling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this piece to wear when my husband and I went snorkeling in the Virgin Islands. I'd never been snorkeling before, and I wanted to make sure I didn't get burnt. I wore this with a pair of swim shorts from Target, and I was totally fine! The top was comfortable and kept me from getting sunburnt all day on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Schilling

customer_reviews.title: SPF caused a rash on body
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for water aerobics. Loved the idea of SPF and they fit well and looked good. But, after several wearings I broke out in a itchy rash on my torso and anywhere the shirt touched my skin. I am aware I am extra sensitive to SPF but was surprised the shirt caused trouble. If you are not prone to being allergic to SPF you are probably fine, but if not, beware. I'm still itching!
customer_reviews.author: Penny B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, though a bit short for taller women
customer_reviews.text: Rashguard top was delivered promptly and in good packaging. Shirt appears to be high quality as well. My one complaint is that it is a bit short. I am tall (6 feet nearly) and thin - and my normal shirt size is xs or s. I bought a small. The sleeves are just long enough, and the shirt is rather short on the torso (does not reach my hips). I am comfortable with the fit - a bit tight, but comfortable for me and it looks nice on my frame. Most shirts and tops are not made with tall women in mind, so if you're tall and looking for length, maybe consider a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Loves Books

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and built to last
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’7”, ~120 lbs, and this fits perfectly around my tummy and on the length of my arms. I use it to teach swim lessons and I love that it fits like a second skin. My only complaint is that after 5+ months the color has begun to fade, but considering the amount of hours this thing spent in the pool and then drying in the sun, I think it’s held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Well made but size up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the lx and it is skin tight, which is what I wanted but if you would would like a looser fit, size up. The color is nice and it's well constructed
customer_reviews.author: A man with a bike

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, runs small
customer_reviews.text: Good basic rash guard - I've used it several times and it's still in like-new condition. It's thin, but blocks the sun and is comfortable even though it's tight. I'm usually an XS (size 0 or 2) for tops but I ordered a small in this and I'm glad I did. It's very tight and form fitting - an XS would have been hard for me to get in and out of. I see people with the same top every time I go on vacation, it's very popular.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Save your vacation, ditch the sunscreen.
customer_reviews.text: Worn for three beach vacations, fits snugly and doesn't roll up. It takes awhile to dry. The UV protection is a lifesaver, literally. I would never spend a day at the beach without it because it reduces the need to slather on sunscreen every hour and hope for the best. You will still get tanned since no UV is 100%, but I was never close to burned in south Texas for a week straight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Sun Solution!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this item! I’ve had a skin issue for most of my life that causes me to break out in hives after sun exposure, and this rash guard top has been a lifesaver! I can finally go out into the sun with no worries. It also keeps you cool in the heat. I recommend sizing up, for reference I’m 5’4 175 lbs 36D and usually wear a 10/12 or size L, bought an XL and it fits perfectly, snug but not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Juliann

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, runs small and short
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color, well made. XS is about right for a 12 year old girl, you'd have to be a Very Small Woman to wear that size, it fits my preteen daughter perfectly though. So if you are so tiny you have trouble finding clothes, rejoice, it's made for you. If you are more average in frame just thin then I'd say start at a M, it runs about a size smaller than most, and don't bother if you are tall, it won't fit. Quality product, good fabric and construction, stretchy in all directions.
customer_reviews.author: Robin in FL

customer_reviews.title: Sizing too small
customer_reviews.text: Size was way too small. Bought for my daughter who wears size xs, bought her a small and it was soo tight it hurt her and she couldn’t wear it. Would probably have been a good product if sized correctly. Suggest you order three or more sizes up.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Great product/disappointing color
customer_reviews.text: This is my second O'Neill rash guard I have ordered in the past 6 months. I have already used my first one ("sea glass green") to go snorkeling four times already and I am pleased with my purchase. The color is beautiful--especially if you have a tan! However, I usually wear a medium in tops, so I would recommend ordering a size up because they are pretty tight (I'm aware rash guards should be tight fitting). Today, I just received my second rash guard in the "fox pink" color and I was disappointed. Online it appears to be a hot pink, but it's more of a dull purplish/pink.
customer_reviews.author: William Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great Rash Guard
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 118.6 lbs, 5'5" and ordered the small... it's very tight, but that's how I want it to fit, for surfing. However, if I weren't using this for water sports, I'd definitely need a medium. This fits me like a stuffed sausage... like panty hose... not the most flattering or comfortable, but you can't have these things fit loose... especially in the water, as it can and will weight you down.
customer_reviews.author: Static Clang

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Really like this I took a chance on a medium being 5'6 at 165lbs. It fits just right not uncomfortable. The blue is not the blue showing in the picture. It's more of a slate/ faded blue color. 4 stars only because the color is off. I'll keep it though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jordy

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fitting
customer_reviews.text: Im usually a size "M" in GAP, BR, or in between "S" or "M" for old Navy. I've to order a "L" and it fits me just right, even though its a little long on the waist (which is no big deal for me). Really comfortable for any Water activities.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara V.

customer_reviews.title: Great swim shirt
customer_reviews.text: These run small, so order a larger size. Keep in mind swim shirts are meant to fit snug so that they feel comfortable in the water too and don't 'suction' to you in an awkward way while swimming. I am a Large/XL normally and have a large bust (D cups). I got the 2XL and it fits great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Harris

customer_reviews.title: it is very small
customer_reviews.text: The product is much smaller than expected. I ordered it for my sister, she is size L and we ask for XL so that it does not fit the body and simply does not fit. my mom is size M, and she tried it on and her bubies are crushed. for this reason we are going to return the product
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for a 5'4" 117 pound lady with small breasts. Normally size 4-6 pants. Size small-medium shirt. We ordered a large, which is way too tight. This might work if you are a competitive swimmer and want to squeeze in, otherwise order 2 sizes up.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Effective, cute, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I spent two weeks in Belize snorkeling every day and this saved me from sunburn. One girl who forgot to bring a rashguard had terrible, red and inflamed skin on her back. This also kept me warm when it got a little chillier and always dried overnight, despite the high humidity. The dark grey color goes with everything. A bit of an annoyance to put on, but it's the same with leggings and wet legs.

customer_reviews.title: Too tight
customer_reviews.text: If you're a swimmer and have broad shoulders, this cut is very small. I ordered a Large( I'm a medium) and I KNOW it should be tight, but if I cant move my arms, I cant swim. As far as color( royal blue) and fabric, its beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Cliv2Swim

customer_reviews.title: Flattering
customer_reviews.text: The fit is kind of snug around the wrist even when I’m an S and bought an M for a more comfortable wear. I had use it only once but other than that minor detail, it is excellent. I’m 5.4, weight 135 lb
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Reviews said it ran a bit small, so I ordered a large in this shirt. Fit very well. Snug like it's supposed to be, but not too tight. Never rode up on me, stayed around my hipline like it is supposed to. Spent a week in the Caribbean waters; never got cold (which I always do), and didn't get any sunburn at all (which I always do). Will order another one, but only because I would like the option of choosing a different color. The color in person of Fox Pink isn't quite as bright as shown on my computer, but it's still quite a lively color. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: karen foss

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: This rashguard exceeded my expectations. So far it has held up through a week of non-stop swimming and snorkeling and has also been through the wash without fading or stretching out. It offered excellent protection against sunburn. For size reference I am 5'5" and wear a 34E; the large was the right length and fit comfortably tight like a rashguard should.
customer_reviews.author: Shhhh

customer_reviews.title: Loved the 1st, but the 2nd, am truly disappointed : (
customer_reviews.text: I bought this black top last year, size Small, & it fit super tight, but perfect (I'm 5'1", 108lbs, 32A, small boned w/ athletic build). I ordered the same exact rash guard for this summer & am so disappointed! It is much thinner & not as substantial, as if they forgot to sew in the inner layer? I have to wear a sports bra underneath for added support. The quality has altered & I was expecting the same awesome product as last year. I'm not even sure if the spf protection is as potent because of the thin material. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: Got this to toss on when I’ve gotten too much sun at the beach. I’m usually a small/medium top so I originally ordered a medium and it was ssooooooo tight! Switched it out for a large and it is still very tight, but the arms would be super loose if I went up a size again!
customer_reviews.author: MSPARK

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: I am normally an 8-10 and according to the website, I would be a M. I ordered a L because I like a bit of extra room when it's hot out and I can barely get the top on. Go at least one size up if not two.
customer_reviews.author: Fire_medic

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The color was more a plain blue rather than deep sea blue and although described as a loose fit T, I found the fit to be irregular. A small head opening, loose material under the arms and snug everywhere else. This item was made of polyester elastin NOT lycra spandex or nylon/spandex as described online, it also had the smell of plastic. I ordered a couple different sizes (i usually wear a xsm, tried sm + med) hoping a skin made in the correct material would arrive, but it never did. The fit was still the same.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: My favorite rash guard
customer_reviews.text: I love these rash guards. I don't know if they loose shape/size over time or if they are being made in different cuts now, but my older ones fit much tighter than this one. With that being said, this one fit as I wanted it to. It's just a little looser than skin tight, but will fit well under my wet suit, and shouldn't move around when I snorkel. I like to buy these every couple of years to have color options and to rotate them and keep them lasting longer. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sound Paddler

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shirt but very slim
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rash guard shirt. It is very tight though and hard to get on and off. I bought the extra small woman's for my granddaughters 8th birthday and it fits tight. My granddaughter is tall for her age but not over weight, she is average or even slim, so buy a bigger size than you would usually.
customer_reviews.author: cherieee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was great to surf in. There wasn't any point where I was hot, it protected my already burned skin, and it didn't get in the way. I got a medium and it's true to size. 140lbs, athletic build and fit perfectly in the arms.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great fit
customer_reviews.text: I live in the desert and covering up is a high priority for skin protection and this item keeps my skin safe. Summer temps here average 115 and this item seems to breathe well. I wear this at the beach and at the lake. Has held up well fits as expected. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: GenXer

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE COLOR IN THE PICTURE
customer_reviews.text: I really bought it for the color in the pic and IT IS NOT like it AT ALL. It does runs small, so you can feel free to order it up to 2 sizes up, although you have perfect body and don't mind to be literally compressed all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Minerva

customer_reviews.title: A little snug but very nice material
customer_reviews.text: I really like the material, I just got a new tattoo a few days ago so I got this for extra sun protection while I'm in Hawaii and I was expecting it to annoy my tatt when I tried it on but it was very smooth and nice. If your a little body conscious I would say to get a size above what you normally where so that its not showing off all your rolls. I got an XL and it was pretty snug so I would have preferred the XXL but the compression helped smooth my rolls a bit so it's not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M.

customer_reviews.title: Great color and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great color and quality. This is labeled as a "performance fit." In normal clothes, i am a small or xsmall. I have another oneill short sleeve rash guard that fits great (loose) in a medium. The medium was considerably snugger in this performance style. It's perfect for surfing or in water activities but i will have to size up since I'm looking for the sun protection in a looser style for kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet but the other reviews were helpful: 135lb, 37" chest, 26" waist approx and the Medium Black fit perfectly. The Tahitian Blue fit too tight in the same size. Either a defect or there's a slight difference in size in these colors.
customer_reviews.author: Aliasa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I live in a beach city in Southern California and I have very fair skin. When I'm out on/in the water, there really isn't enough sunscreen for someone like me. So this perfect. It's so lightweight but offers full protection to my chest, arms, and back. And as soon as you're out of the water, it dries faster than my bathing suit bottoms. Love love love.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an M size and it looks like XS. Way too small. Probably would fit a teenager. I am 179 cm high and 65 kg weight. Chest about 80 cm. Unfortunately it will not work for me, will have to give it to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Abdiel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: NOT true to size but looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the white full sleeve swim shirt in small. I'm 5'9, 140lbs, athletic shape, size 34B bra. I normally wear an Extra Small top but read the reviews and went up a size. It still fit SUPER skin tight. I'm returning it and getting a Medium size. I think that will do the trick. Still fitted but at least able to breathe comfortably. The quality is very nice, not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: TracieM

customer_reviews.title: Runs extremely small
customer_reviews.text: This rashguard runs extremely small so if you plan on buying one, order 3-4 sizes up. It is ridiculous. I'm giving mine to my 9 year old daughter.
customer_reviews.author: MamaFratelli

customer_reviews.title: I fits perfect, very tight but it is supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: I am 117 lbs. and 5'3" tall and I bought a size small. I fits perfect, very tight but it is supposed to be. If you are looking for something that doesn't show ever curve buy at least one size up. The arms are also very slim so if you have larger muscles maybe size up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: nice fabric uv protection
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item because it was much too tight. The larger size were more expensive, but I must say the quality was super. Will try another item from. your selections.
customer_reviews.author: Evis

customer_reviews.title: Fits great looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I got the XL which fit me (5'7", 200lbs athletic) like a glove on land and perfectly in the water. I wear it for swimming since I can't reach all of my back for suntan lotion and it's UV protection is great. A little tight on the wrists for me and I waterboarded myself trying to get out of it but that goes with the territory. Looks great on. Order in whatever size you normally wear or go a size smaller if you're between. Should feel 'too' tight when you try it on but not so tight you can't move.
customer_reviews.author: RM Willis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Surfing in Sri Lanka so the tight fit a bit revealing (size c cup). Good quality. If I put on a little weight it would have been better to have replaced for larger size. I am 5.4 ft and weigh 126 pounds (57 kilos).
customer_reviews.author: christine meier

customer_reviews.title: Love this great swim-shirt, but Please some new colors!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a couple of other brands now, just looking for some more exciting colors and color combinations than O'Neill offers, but the other ones just don't measure up to the quality, fit, and comfort of the O'Neill products. I LOVE my swim shirt (have both the long and short sleeve ones) and the fit is perfect. For info purposes, I am a daily lap swimmer (5'8", 130lbs) and I wear a small. It's a perfect, snug fit -- feels great in the water and protects from the sun. So, all I could ask for on top of all this would be some new colors to spice up the daily swim!
customer_reviews.author: Watergirl

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to be tight
customer_reviews.text: Everyone at the pool asks about this. Keeps my shoulders warm. Fits very very very tight. Supposed to. Will stretch out a bit in time and won't be so hard to get on. Surfers wear these to keep warm and avoid sunburn. I feel more shapely in it. It doesn't ride up in the water. I just wear an old bra and matching swim suit bottom with it. I'm 5'4" and weigh 140lb and large works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Firebird

customer_reviews.title: Too tight for thick arms
customer_reviews.text: I felt like a stuffed sausage in this, especially on my arms, so I returned it. I am 5'7/150 pounds/34D and there was just no way that the large would be comfortable. It was making me claustrophobic. Order up a couple of sizes if you are curvy!
customer_reviews.author: HayesCrewTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the O'Neill wetsuits! I go kayaking a lot and I cannot leave the house without wearing these. SOMETHING TO BE AWARE OF: I had ordered the teal in the same size as the royal blue one but for some weird reason the blue one was twice as big?? Still love the product but I have no clue why that happened? lol
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Very snug as expected, good quality. We bought these for a trip to a beach for extra warmth while in the water. Just know, this is a rash guard, not a swim shirt. It’s supposed to be tight. Worked well for us!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gudde

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a size larger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shirt to wear during two snorkeling trips over the course of a week. I did not buy it to wear under a scuba suit. For that reason, I bought a size larger than I usually wear, and it fits like a snug shirt that still allows movement, not a "skin" that you would wear under a scuba suit. I prefer this fit, and will really enjoy it. The color (Riviera) is a lovely medium blue - the picture does not do the color justice; it is more rich than the photo shows. I am thinking of ordering another one in another color. I can't attest for the sun block effect; I'll update this post in early October.
customer_reviews.author: LisaJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shirt! Fit exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shirt! Fit exactly as expected. Used 3 days for kayaking in Maine. Kept me just right as far as temperature, cool if got wet while sun was beating and warm when cloudy. Dried fast. I am 5'5, 118 lbs. Ordered the small. Another girl 5'2, 115 lbs used as well. Fit skin tight. No sun burn. Will continue to buy these shirts for the sun. VERY happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: D Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a medium in shirts, sometimes even small. I am so glad I went with the large! I know how these skins are supposed to fit, and I wanted it to be skin tight. The large, even though a size up, still fits me skin tight to where it is difficult to get on and off. I know it will stay in place and there will be know riding up. Not sure my arms would have fit in a medium. I love the material and it is such good quality for the price. O'Neill is one of my favorite brands and has been for almost 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: watergirl

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ITTT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i'm going white water rafting in two weeks so I haven't seen it perform on water yet. I am 130lb and 160cm and medium is usually my size. I was worried because some reviews said to size up, but I am very glad I didn't, it is a slim fit but its very comfortable, i had no trouble raising my arms and i didn't feel any pull. It's very flattering to my figure. I will update once I get to use it on water! :)
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela FX

customer_reviews.title: Tight; shrinks in dryer
customer_reviews.text: "Skins" is an appropriate name; it is skin tight & mashes a full busted figure even in the Large size. I wore mine snorkeling under a wet suit so it wasn't visible. The labels says line dry, but mine accidentally went into the dryer, and came out even tighter than it started. PRO: stand up collar protects your collarbone & back of neck from the sun. ALTERNATIVE: Danskin makes long-sleeved, quick-dry exercise shirts - made me more comfortable on the beach, and worked well for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: catlou

customer_reviews.title: It was great and served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I used this while on vacation in the Bahamas. It was great and served its purpose. I went snorkeling on two different occasions during my trip and the rash guard kept me warm and safe from sunburn. The only downside is the fit. It is sized extremely small so whatever size you are normally, considering sizing up one or two sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Runs Small!
customer_reviews.text: These run super small! I have a teenage daughter who normally wears size 0 or XXS. I purchased this in XS thinking that it will fit generously. It fit so tight, my daughter started gagging and choking. When she finally got it on, it fit unusually tight, it was hilarious! I'm hoping a Small size would do better.
customer_reviews.author: rhetse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and sun coverage
customer_reviews.text: I'm 140lbs, 5'2", 29" waist, 36" chest and I got a medium. It's very fitting and I use it to wear under my shortie wetsuit for diving. Excellent price and sun coverage. I got the color black and when I received it I rinsed with cold water. And some dark ink was running. So make sure you rinse first before throwing it in with the rest of your laundry!
customer_reviews.author: Dandileon

customer_reviews.title: Made very form-fitting!!
customer_reviews.text: Very tight!! I ordered a size up knowing that it was made tight, but still could t wear it. I’m 5’7, 120 lbs and ordered a medium. You could see every detail under the shirt :/ Had to return. If I were going to order again, it’s have to be a large or xlarge.
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking shirt and the fit is very snug
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved it but returned it. She needed a swim shirt with SPF protection and these looked cool. Keep in mind that this is a wetsuit and it fits very, very tightly. Don't get me wrong as I thought it looked great but maybe not so good for the community pool. Buy a larger size than you think you'll need if you plan to wear a bikini top underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. High

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product however very tight fit. So unless you are looking for a second skin literally, a size up is better
customer_reviews.author: christine meier

customer_reviews.title: Size up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I don’t have to sunscreen my entire body all the time to protect it from the AZ sun. If you want a compression type fit, size up one size. If you want a more relaxed fit, go up 2. I ordered a medium and it was too fitted and made my mama belly too obvi and was pulling across my shoulders, so I sized up to a large.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Ross

customer_reviews.title: O'Neill makes the best rash guards but they do run tight
customer_reviews.text: O'Neill makes a very good quality rash guard but they are tight. I'm still going to wear the one I bought but I will probably go up a size or two next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: O'Neill UV Skins, use for Snorkeling in Hawaii
customer_reviews.text: The color is exactly as viewed. Although I wear a large in most things, this is a snug large but I believe this how it is supposed to be for its function in the water. I am tall, 5'11" and the sleeve and body length is a good fit. The slight compression of the fit is good to keep the water from bogging you down. I would buy this again. A tremendous value.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Snug is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: Material seems ok- haven't tested sun protection - purchased a medium and it's way to snug! I normally wear medium but medium felt like extra small! I get that it's a skin but I can barely fit my head or hands in the holes! I am very small frame! Wrists are 5.25 in- don't want to even attempt to order large as I don't have time before my vacation to order a new one! Bought two and both are going back!
customer_reviews.author: Purple Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I'm always cold at the beach, if is not the wind then the cold water or whatever, normally I cannot even stay in the water for more than 20 min. If I'd know this was so helpfull I'd bought one long time ago. Now, I'm protected from the sun, not only in the beach but at any place, I went to Machu Picchu and it was so sunny, but I wore it and I felt cool and protected from sunburns. I also used it under my clothes in cold weather to keep me warm, and works perfectly. I can ask for a more useful piece. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andreina Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Buy one to two sizes bigger then you usually wear.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this in a size medium but very tight so I bought one in a size large. Oh my goodness still very tight. I have never worn a size large. The material and look is great just wish it was larger. I guess I need to order an X-large.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but fits snug!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for sun protection while snorkeling in the Caribbean, and it served that purpose nicely! I never once got burned. It is a very nice color and style - definitely shows off your shape! I usually wear a Small, but bought this in Medium; it was still very snug. After wearing it for several hours, there were marks from the seams on my arms after taking it off. I'm sure as a rash guard you would want it that way, but just for the SPF, I think I would have preferred a Large (I am 5'7", 130 lbs, slim, but athletic/ muscular). Nice product quality, material.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: O'Neill Women's Basic Skins Upf 50+ Long Sleeve Rash Guard
product_meta.description: World-renowned O'Neill quality at value-driven prices. The Basic Skins offers U.P.F. 50+ Ultraviolet Protection with cleanly designed graphics and minimal seam placement for rash prevention. Flatlock Stitched Breathable Seams.
feature_bullets: Skin Cancer Foundation Recommended Product; UPF 50+ Ultraviolet Protection
Perfect For Surfing, Swimming, Paddle Sports, Boating, And Beach Days
Minimal Seam Placement For Maximum Rash Protection
Performance Fit: Form-Fitting Tight Layer Fits Like A Second Skin
